citeinfo.origin: Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Ocean Service (NOS), Coastal Services Center (CSC)
citeinfo.title: Unexploded Ordnances

idinfo.useconst: These data are intended for coastal and ocean use planning. Not for navigation.

descript.abstract:
Unexploded ordnance (or UXOs/UXBs, sometimes identified as UO) are explosive weapons (bombs, bullets, shells, grenades, land mines, naval mines, etc.) that did not explode when they were employed and still pose a risk of detonation, potentially many decades after they were used or discarded.
While “UXO” is widely and informally used, munitions and explosives of concern (MEC) is the current preferred terminology within the remediation community.
This is NOT a complete collection of unexploded ordnance on the seafloor, nor are the locations to be considered exact. The presence and locations of the unexploded ordnance have been derived from graphical representations recorded on NOAA Raster Navigation Charts. These data are intended for coastal and ocean planning. Not for navigation.
descript.purpose: To support coastal and ocean planning and other activities pursuant to the Coastal Zone Management Act, Energy Policy Act, Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act, National Environmental Policy Act, Rivers and Harbors Act and the Submerged Lands Act.

dataqual.logic: These data are believed to be logically consistent. Geometry is topologically clean.
dataqual.complete: Spatial and attribute properties are believed to be complete, although attribute information has been simplified. Geometric thresholds from original data are preserved. No tests have been completed for exhaustiveness.

horizpa.horizpar: Maximum scale of intended use is 1:80,000.

srcinfo.srccontr: Electronic Navigational Charts Electronic Nautical Charts Raster Navigational Charts Raster Nautical Charts APPROACH_HARBOR_DMPGRD_point APPROACH_HARBOR_DMPGRD_polygon APPROACH_HARBOR_OBSTRN_point APPROACH_HARBOR_OBSTRN_polygon COASTAL_DMPGRD_point COASTAL_DMPGRD_polygon COASTAL_OBSTRN_point COASTAL_OBSTRN_polygon GENERAL_DMPGRD_point GENERAL_DMPGRD_polygon GENERAL_OBSTRN_point GENERAL_OBSTRN_polygon OVERVIEW_DMPGRD_point OVERVIEW_DMPGRD_polygon OVERVIEW_OBSTRN_point OVERVIEW_OBSTRN_polygon

procstep.procdesc:
• Go to: http://ocs-spatial.ncd.noaa.gov/SpatialDirect/translationServlet?SSFunction=prepareFetch • Click Set Search Max Extent • Select the following themes: APPROACH_HARBOR_DMPGRD_point APPROACH_HARBOR_DMPGRD_polygon APPROACH_HARBOR_OBSTRN_point APPROACH_HARBOR_OBSTRN_polygon COASTAL_DMPGRD_point COASTAL_DMPGRD_polygon COASTAL_OBSTRN_point COASTAL_OBSTRN_polygon GENERAL_DMPGRD_point GENERAL_DMPGRD_polygon GENERAL_OBSTRN_point GENERAL_OBSTRN_polygon OVERVIEW_DMPGRD_point OVERVIEW_DMPGRD_polygon OVERVIEW_OBSTRN_point OVERVIEW_OBSTRN_polygon • Select ESRI Shape and Lat/Long WGS84, and click Order Data • Download the files , convert to file geodatabase and pull into ArcMap • Pull in ArcGIS Map Service displaying Raster Nautical Chart (RNC) data, using the url: http://egisws02.nos.noaa.gov/ArcGIS/rest/services/RNC • Buffer all DMPGRD point feature classes to 1000 feet • Append all DMPGRD buffered and polygon feature classes together into 1 • Delete all records with a CATDPG entry of “spoil dumping ground” or “vessel dumping ground” • Delete features that are duplicates • Visually confirm and adjust size, placement, and description of each feature feature (making sure that projection is set to proper UTM zone while editing), as compared to the overlaid image of the RNC at a 1:20,000 scale • Buffer all OBSTRN point feature classes to 1000 feet • Append all OBSTRN buffered and polygon feature classes together into 1 • Select features using the following expression: " I N F O R M " I N ( ' B o m b i n g t a r g e t ' , ' D a n g e r E x p l o s i v e s ' , ' D a n g e r e x p l o s i v e ' , ' D a n g e r e x p l o s i v e s ' , ' D a n g e r , u n e x p l o d e d b o m b s a n d s h e l l s . D e p t h s s u b j e c t t o c h a n g e b e c a u s e o f s h i f t i n g s t e e l . ' , ' D a n g e r o u s ' , ' D e p t h c h a r g e ' , ' E x p l o s i v e ' , ' E x p l o s i v e s ' , ' E x p l o s i v e s ( r e p o r t e d 1 9 7 8 ) ' , ' E x p l o s i v e s J e t t i s o n e d 1 9 5 2 ' , ' E x p l o s i v e s r e p ' , ' E x p l o s i v e s r e p o r t e d ' , ' M i n e ' , ' T o r p e d o ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d B o m b s ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d O r d i n a n c e r e p o r t e d 1 9 9 9 ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d O r d n a n c e ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d O r d n a n c e R e p 2 0 0 7 ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d O r d n a n c e R e p o r t e d ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d O r d n a n c e r e p o r t e d 1 9 8 7 ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d O r d n a n c e , R e p o r t e d i n 1 9 9 0 ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d O r d n a n c e , r e p 1 9 8 5 ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d O r d n a n c e , r e p 1 9 8 9 ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d T o r p e d o ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d b o m b ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d b o m b ( R e p M a y 1 9 6 3 ) ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d b o m b , s u r v e y e d i n A u g 1 9 6 8 ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d b o m b s ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d b o m b s R e p o r t e d ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d d e p t h c h a r g e ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d d e p t h c h a r g e R e p o r t e d ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d d e p t h c h a r g e r e p o r t e d i n 1 9 5 7 ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d d e p t h c h a r g e s ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d d e p t h c h a r g e s , s u r v e y e d i n A p r 1 9 5 3 ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d m i n e r e p o r t e d i n A u g 1 9 8 1 ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d o r d i n a n c e ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d o r d n a n c e ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d o r d n a n c e ( a r t i l l e r y s h e l l s ) h a v e b e e n d i s c o v e r e d i n t h e v i c i n i t y o f t h e C r o w l e y M a r i t i m e d o c k . T h e o r d n a n c e a r e p o t e n t i a l l y h a z a r d o u s a n d m a r i n e r s a r e a d v i s e d n o t t o a n c h o r i n t h e o r u s e a n c h o r s t o a s s i s t i n m o o r i n g t o t h e d o c k . ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d o r d n a n c e R e p o r t e d ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d o r d n a n c e r e p 2 0 0 9 ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d o r d n a n c e r e p o r t e d ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d o r d n a n c e r e p o r t e d i n 1 9 7 0 ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d o r d n a n c e r e p o r t e d i n J a n 1 9 8 9 ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d o r d n a n c e r e p o r t e d i n J u l - S e p 1 9 9 8 , M u l t i p l e o b s t r u c t i o n s ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d o r d n a n c e , R e p o r t e d ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d o r d n a n c e , r e p o r t e d ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d o r d n a n c e , r e p o r t e d i n 1 9 6 7 ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d o r d n a n c e , r e p o r t e d i n 1 9 8 7 ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d o r d n a n c e , r e p o r t e d i n 1 9 9 2 ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d o r d n a n c e . R e f e r t o S e c t i o n - 1 S p e c i a l n o t i c e s o f L N M 4 9 / 0 7 . ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d p r o j e c t i l e s R e p o r t e d ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d t o r p e d o ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d t o r p e d o ( r e p 2 0 0 7 ) ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d t o r p e d o , r e p o r t e d i n 1 9 8 5 ' , ' U n e x p l o d e d t o r p e d o , r e p o r t e d i n N o v 1 9 6 5 ' , ' u n e x p l o d e d d e p t h c h a r g e ' ) • Switch selection and delete selected features • Delete features that are duplicates • Visually confirm and adjust size, placement, and description of each feature feature (making sure that projection is set to proper UTM zone while editing), as compared to the overlaid image of the RNC at a 1:20,000 scale • Append remaining features to DMPGRD feature class • Add new records that may have been missed to final feature class by visually comparing to the overlaid image of the RNC at a 1:20,000 scale
• Import feature class into a new blank file geodatabase and rename the following fields and aliases: INFORM?description SORDAT?sourceDate SORIND?rnc • Delete extraneous fields

enttyp.enttypd: Unexploded ordnance (or UXOs/UXBs, sometimes identified as UO) are explosive weapons (bombs, bullets, shells, grenades, land mines, naval mines, etc.) that did not explode when they were employed and still pose a risk of detonation, potentially many decades after they were used or discarded.

Month, day, and year when first reported
Length of feature in internal units.
